issue.title: Adjusted the warning message to be more descriptive
issue.body: ## Improve warning message for multiple lockfiles detection ### What? Enhances the warning message when multiple lockfiles are detected to provide clearer guidance to users. ### Why? The previous warning message was less informative and didn't provide clear instructions on how to resolve the issue. The improved message explicitly mentions: - That Next.js is inferring the workspace root - How to silence the warning by setting `turbopack.root` in the Next.js config - A link to documentation for more information ### How? Updated the warning text to be more descriptive and helpful, including a link to the relevant documentation. Addresses #81864

body:
Hi folks -

This error message was a bit confusing, so we adjusted it in #82052 to explain how you can silence it. To avoid getting this warning, you'd need to either ensure your application only has 1 lockfile, or alternatively explicitly specify the root of your application in `nextConfig.turbopack.root` ([docs](https://nextjs.org/docs/app/api-reference/config/next-config-js/turbopack#root-directory)). 

As for the implementation details, Turbopack is attempting to locate the root dir of your project and is using lockfiles to do so.  The algorithm recursively looks upward through the filesystem and may catch stray lockfiles in parent directories that don't actually correspond with your application. When you see this warning message, it means that Turbopack inferred the root is the directory of the selected lockfile but we aren't 100% confident that it's the correct root.
in my case, nextjs selects project's parent directory where reside all my projects. setting `turbopack.root` nor removing `--turbopack` flag from CLI command do not help

issue.title: Warning about multiple lockfiles in monorepo - Still occurring
issue.body:
### Link to the code that reproduces this issue

https://github.com/Tanavya/nextjs-multiple-lockfiles-bug

### To Reproduce

Readme has the steps, but here is a copy.

1. bun install - this also installs dependencies in frontend due to the postinstall
2. cd frontend
3. bun run dev
```
$ next dev --turbopack
 ‚ö† Warning: Found multiple lockfiles. Selecting /Users/tanavya/Development/WealthyPlanetDev/multiple-lockfiles-bug/bun.lockb.
   Consider removing the lockfiles at:
   * /Users/tanavya/Development/WealthyPlanetDev/multiple-lockfiles-bug/frontend/bun.lockb

   ‚ñ≤ Next.js 15.4.4 (Turbopack)
   - Local:        http://localhost:3000
   - Network:      http://10.0.0.227:3000

 ‚úì Starting...
 ‚úì Ready in 1341ms
```
4. Try playing around with nextConfig.turbopack.root but nothing works!

### Current vs. Expected behavior

I would expect not to see the warning and nextjs to start up normally.

### Provide environment information

```bash
bunx --no-install next info
 ‚ö† Warning: Found multiple lockfiles. Selecting /Users/tanavya/Development/WealthyPlanetDev/multiple-lockfiles-bug/bun.lockb.
   Consider removing the lockfiles at:
   * /Users/tanavya/Development/WealthyPlanetDev/multiple-lockfiles-bug/frontend/bun.lockb

warning ../package.json: No license field

Operating System:
  Platform: darwin
  Arch: arm64
  Version: Darwin Kernel Version 23.1.0: Mon Oct  9 21:32:52 PDT 2023; root:xnu-10002.41.9~7/RELEASE_ARM64_T8122
  Available memory (MB): 24576
  Available CPU cores: 8
Binaries:
  Node: 20.16.0
  npm: 9.8.1
  Yarn: 1.22.22
  pnpm: 9.0.4
Relevant Packages:
  next: 15.4.4 // Latest available version is detected (15.4.4).
  eslint-config-next: 15.4.4
  react: 19.1.0
  react-dom: 19.1.0
  typescript: 5.8.3
Next.js Config:
  output: N/A
```

### Which area(s) are affected? (Select all that apply)

Turbopack, Not sure

### Which stage(s) are affected? (Select all that apply)

next dev (local)

### Additional context

I checked out this issue first: https://github.com/vercel/next.js/issues/81864 but it didn't help adding the `nextConfig.turbopack.root` . I tried both ` path.join(__dirname, "..")` and ` path.join(__dirname, ".")`

body:
@ztanner Thanks for the updates. Looks like this is still an issue.
As others have mentioned, I can also confirm that adding the `turbopack.root` config doesn‚Äôt suppress the warning. My Next.js project doesn‚Äôt even have Turbopack enabled.

> [@ztanner](https://github.com/ztanner) Thanks for the updates. Looks like this is still an issue. As others have mentioned, I can also confirm that adding the `turbopack.root` config doesn‚Äôt suppress the warning. My Next.js project doesn‚Äôt even have Turbopack enabled.

Thanks for flagging @szhsin. Looks like there's a bug in the messaging here. If you aren't using Turbopack, you can set an explicit root directory via [outputFileTracingRoot](https://nextjs.org/docs/app/api-reference/config/next-config-js/output#caveats) which should silence the warning.

issue.title: fix: display multiple lockfile warn if neither `outputFileTracingRoot` or `turbopack.root` option is provided
issue.body:
> Better to be reviewed with "Hide whitespace".

This PR fixed a bug where `findRootDir()` was called and displayed multiple lockfile warnings even if the app had `turbopack.root`, as there was no `outputFileTracingRoot`.

x-ref: https://github.com/vercel/next.js/pull/82164#discussion_r2240470772

Also, added information about the `outputFileTracingRoot` option and its docs to the warning, as it was omitted from https://github.com/vercel/next.js/pull/82052.

Closes https://github.com/vercel/next.js/issues/81864
Closes https://github.com/vercel/next.js/issues/82096

issue.title: fix: correctly warn about multiple lockfiles in monorepo
issue.body:
Closes https://github.com/vercel/next.js/issues/81864
Closes https://github.com/vercel/next.js/issues/82096
